meanings.definition: A type of food made from ground meat, typically served in a bun.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious burgout at the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The food truck sells the best burgout in town.
meanings.sent3: The burgout was so big, it barely fit in my mouth!
meanings.sent4: The juicy burgout was a flavor explosion in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the sizzling burgout made my stomach growl.

meanings.definition: To cook something over an open flame.
meanings.sent1: Let's burgout some marshmallows for s'mores.
meanings.sent2: We can burgout hot dogs on the campfire.
meanings.sent3: He tried to burgout the steak but ended up burning it.
meanings.sent4: She burgouted the vegetables to perfection over the fire.
meanings.sent5: Burgouting marshmallows is a fun camping tradition.

meanings.definition: A small, round object used in various games.
meanings.sent1: The kids played with a colorful burgout in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The burgout rolled under the couch during the game.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on the burgout and it popped!
meanings.sent4: The shiny burgout gleamed under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The burgout bounced unpredictably during the game.
